weather_report:
As night cloaks Downtown San Francisco, the city shimmers under a canopy of disparate lights that reflect a sense of calm and quietude. The forecast reveals a gentle embrace of partly cloudy skies, with the temperature dipping to a cool 46 degrees. A light northwest breeze whispers among the palms, adding a touch of briskness to the evening air. 

Looking ahead to Tuesday, a soft dawn approaches with promise, offering a mostly sunny day that warms up to the upper fifties before tempering into the early afternoon. The North wind will keep things refreshingly cool, ensuring the city remains lively yet pleasant—ideal for a stroll through hidden alleys or a leisurely café visit. Although the fog that often blankets the Bay is yet to make its appearance this evening, the morning may reveal remnants of the marine layer hugging the coast. Best to layer up; a light jacket will accompany you well, serving as a shield against the slight chill that lingers. While the light fades, consider a cozy evening with a cherished book or a piano composition resonating through your spaces, while anticipation for the morrow crystallizes in your mind.
